perturbation.original_text:
1.3 “Aimmune Agreement Entities” means Aimmune’s Affiliates and Sublicensees (excluding distributors).

1.70 “Selling Party” means Aimmune or another Aimmune Agreement Entity.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.3 “Aimmune Agreement Entities” means Aimmune’s Affiliates, Sublicensees, and distributors.

1.70 “Selling Party” means Aimmune or another Aimmune Subsidiary.
perturbation.explanation: Here, the terms 'Aimmune Agreement Entities' and 'Selling Party' are altered to include 'distributors'. This contradicts the original definition that excludes them, creating uncertainty as to which entities are bound by the agreement and who the seller is. Therefore the parties could have conflicting understanding of which parties are ultimately bound by the agreement

perturbation.original_text:
1.64 “Regulatory Approval” means, with respect to any biopharmaceutical product in any regulatory jurisdiction for a given indication, approval from the applicable Regulatory Authority permitting the manufacture, sale, distribution or Commercialization of such biopharmaceutical product in such regulatory jurisdiction for such indication in accordance with Applicable Law, including any Pricing Approvals.

1.65 “Regulatory Authority” means, in a particular country or regulatory jurisdiction, any applicable Governmental Authority involved in granting Regulatory Approval and/or, to the extent required in such country or regulatory jurisdiction, governmental Pricing Approval of a biopharmaceutical product in such country or regulatory jurisdiction.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.64 “Regulatory Approval” means, with respect to any biopharmaceutical product in any regulatory jurisdiction for a given indication, approval from the applicable Regulatory Authority permitting the manufacture, sale, distribution or Commercialization of such biopharmaceutical product in such regulatory jurisdiction for such indication in accordance with Applicable Law, excluding any Pricing Approvals.

1.65 “Regulatory Authority” means, in a particular country or regulatory jurisdiction, any applicable Governmental Authority involved in granting Regulatory Approval.
perturbation.explanation: The definitions of 'Regulatory Approval' and 'Regulatory Authority' are modified to remove any mention of pricing approvals. This creates a direct contradiction as it's unclear whether obtaining pricing approvals is necessary for commercializing a product, potentially causing disputes between the parties.

perturbation.original_text:
9.1.1 General. Subject to the provisions of this Section 9.1.1 and except as expressly set forth otherwise in this Agreement, (i) Xencor shall
solely own Patents Covering any Xencor Invention (“Xencor Collaboration Patents”), and (ii) Aimmune shall solely own Patents Covering any
Aimmune Invention (“Aimmune Collaboration Patents”). All Joint Inventions shall be jointly owned by the Parties, and Patents Covering Joint
Inventions shall be referred to as “Joint Collaboration Patents”.
perturbation.changed_text:
9.1.1 General. Subject to the provisions of this Section 9.1.1 and except as expressly set forth otherwise in this Agreement, (i) Xencor shall
solely own Patents Covering any Xencor Invention (“Xencor Product Patents”), and (ii) Aimmune shall solely own Patents Covering any
Aimmune Invention (“Aimmune Product Patents”). All Joint Inventions shall be jointly owned by the Parties, and Patents Covering Joint
Inventions shall be referred to as “Joint Product Patents”.
perturbation.explanation: Here, the renaming of Xencor, Aimmune, and Joint Collaboration Patents to Xencor, Aimmune, and Joint Product Patents respectively introduces confusion. Since the original definitions are tied to the term 'Collaboration' versus 'Product' patents, using 'Product' when collaboration is required creates an ambiguity leading to enforcement challenges on the ownership of the patents.
